div1.head: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, August 13, 1937
div1.opener:
COMPAÑIA SUNOCO DE CUBA, S.A.
AGENTES EXCLUSIVOS DE
SUN OIL COMPANY
SUN OILS
AVENIDA MENOCAL NO. 102-A
HABANA.
Aug. 13, 1937.
CABLE Y}
TELEGRAFO}
“SUNOCO”
CLAVE BENTLEY
TELEFONO U-6148
SUNOCO
DESTILADO AL MERCURIO
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
In looking over my rather extensive “collection” of inform-
ative articles, clippings, editorials, etc., on the yellow fever
experiments, I happened to run across the enclosed article in “The
Military Surgeon” for February, 1929, by Major General Merritte W.
Ireland, at that time Surgeon general of the Army, now retired.

If you have not already prepared your proposed talk for
the Mayo Clinic staff, I think you will find this article of great
help. Also, I am inclosing the article published by Dr. Agramonte
in the “Scientific Monthly” for December, 1915, entitled “The Inside
History of a Great Medical Discovery” and pages 1417-18-19 from the
Official Army Register for 1936, being the pages in the Register
devoted to “The Roll of Honor”, all of which I trust you will find
of interest for the purpose you have in mind.

Will you be kind enough to return the above to me when and
as they shall have served your purpose. I regret my inability to
obtain additional copies of the articles by General Ireland and Dr.
Agramonte. The “Roll of Honor” is published annually but I do not
happen to have the 1937 issue of the Register in my possession.

I hope you will not think I intend to bother you with an
extensive correspondence in the effort to comply with the simple
request contained in your original letter. I do, however, want you
to have all information possible to the end that your “talk” to the
Staff of Mayo Clinic may be as close to accurate in its details as
possible.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, John J. Moran Address:
John J. Moran,
c/o Cia. Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.,
Avenida Menocal No. 102-A
Havana, Cuba.
